bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, May 29, 1900

div1.p: Lazear writes about family plans for the summer. He is pleased to be named a member of a board to study infectious diseases, headed by Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, May 29, 1900
div1.p:
I was glad
to get your letter today
and learn just what
your plans are.

I had received another
letter a day or two ago.
I am glad you enjoyed
your stay at Atlantic
City. I know you
are glad to get to
Hatley. It is always
nice there. Mabel had
not mentioned the idea
of her going to Hatley.

I fear it would not
be practicable. It would
be impossible to have
proper arrangements
there and then people would
call and it would not
be pleasant for Mabel.

There are to be important
scientific investigations
here. The Surgeon General
has appointed a board
of which I am a member
and headed by Dr Reed
a very well known
bacteriologist to study
the infectious diseases
of Cuba. The work
will probably last a
year or two and will
be very complete.

I am very glad of
this arrangement as
we will have facilities and opportunities
that I could not have working
alone. I think you will enjoy
staying in Beverly for a while this
summer. There are a member
of historically interesting places near
there and then it is a very short
ride to Boston. The trollies are
very good there on warm days
but one has to be careful
about them in cold weather
for it is easy to get chilled
in that climate.

We have had very little hot
weather here. It has rained
most of the time this month.
